alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 12 at 3:21AM MDT until October 13 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOWFALL EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF THE BLACK HILLS TODAY INTO FRIDAY... .A potent storm system will bring heavy precipitation and strong winds to the region today through Friday. Rain has started across the Black Hills and southwestern South Dakota. As the morning progresses and colder air wraps into the system, rain will change over to snow in the Black Hills. Accumulating snow is expected over much of the Black Hills through Friday morning, particularly across higher elevations of the northern and central hills. Some snow will also be possible if rain changes to snow in the Black Hills foothills tonight. If this does occur, there may be light accumulations. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts in the higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...The Northern Black Hills and the Central Black Hills. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 6 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
